page.title: 01DARTMOOR BUCKLAND AREA
page.content: The main occupation is farming. The area is mostly open moorland, pasture fields and mixed woodlands. There are isolated granite farmhouses and hamlets but few modern buildings because of National Park regulations. Tourists visit the area because of its unspoilt beauty.There is a caravan and camping site at{Waterleat.}On Rippon Tor there is a Rifle Range.The Ten Commandments are carved on Buckland Beacon.The largest community is at{ {Buckland-in-the-Moor.}There is one hotel. The church dates back to Norman times.A Community Hall has just been completed.Thatched cottages are 17th. Century.Some of them are holiday homes or offer bed and breakfast.'The Gardens' supplies organically grown fruit and vegetables.The River Dart curves through the area to the South.
